citation.article-title: Alkanibacter difficilis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Singularimonas variicoloris gen. nov., sp. nov., hexane-degrading bacteria isolated from a hexane-treated biofilter.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Singularimonas variicoloris sp. nov.
Singularimonas variicoloris (va.ri.i.co.lo′ris. L. adj. varius varying; L. gen. n. coloris of colour; N.L. gen n. variicoloris of varying colour).
Displays the following characteristics in addition to those given in the genus description.
Colonies vary in colour between yellow, orange and brown.
Colonies on trypticase soy agar are 1–3 mm in diameter, umbonate and are each surrounded by a flat, pale white rim.
The colour is more intense in the centre of the colony.
Gram-staining is negative and the KOH and aminopeptidase tests give positive results.
The DNA G+C content is 64.9 mol% (sd, 0.07).
Growth is positive with hexane on minimal medium agar but is negative in liquid medium.

Positive for growth on the following: Tween 40, α-d-glucose, methyl pyruvate, monomethyl succinate, cis-aconitic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, alaninamide, l-alanylglycine, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-threonine and urocanic acid.

No growth occurs on the following: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, Tween 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, i-erythritol, d-fructose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, glucose, myo-inositol, α-d-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-psicose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol, acetic acid, citric acid, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, d-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, dl-lactic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, caprate, adipate, malate, glucuronamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, d-serine, l-serine, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, inosine, uridine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, glucose 1-phosphate and glucose 6-phosphate.
Negative for reduction of nitrate, indole production, arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-galactosidase and β-glucosidase.
The major fatty acids are 14 : 0 3-OH, 16 : 0 and 18 : 1cis11; iso-branched fatty acids are present.
The DNA G+C content is 64.9 mol% (sd, 0.07).
The type strain, MN28T (=DSM 15731T=LMG 22844T), was isolated from an industrial biofilter.
